questions.question: How do you determine if there is a vertical asymptote for a rational function?

choices.answer: Factors remain in the denominator after simplification.
Factors remain in the numerator after simplification
Factors cancel out of the numerator & denominator.
The  numerator's degree is 1 more than the denominator's.

questions.question: How do you determine if there is a slant asymptote for a rational function?

choices.answer: Factors remain in the denominator after simplification.
Factors remain in the numerator after simplification
Factors cancel out of the numerator & denominator.
The  numerator's degree is 1 more than the denominator's.

questions.question: How do you determine if there is a hole in the graph for a rational function?

choices.answer: Factors remain in the denominator after simplification.
Factors remain in the numerator after simplification

questions.question: What do you look at to determine if there is a horizontal asymptote for a rational function?

choices.answer: the higest powered term in the numerator
the highest powered term in the denominator
Highest powered terms of the numerator & denominator
Highest powered term in congress

questions.question: Does the graph of the given function have any holes in it? If so where?

choices.answer: There are no holes in this graph.
There is a hole in this graph @ x=-2
There is a hole in this graph @ x=-5/3
There are two holes in this graph @ x=-2 and -5/3

questions.question: Does the graph of the given function have any vertical asymptotes? If so where?

choices.answer: There are no vertical asymptotes.
There are two vertical asymptotes @ x = 2, 5/3
There is a vertical asymptote @ x = 2
There are three vertical asymptotes @ x = -2,2, -5/3

questions.question: Does the graph of the given function have any slant asymptotes? If so where?

choices.answer: There are no slant asymptotes.
There are two slant asymptotes @ y = -2, -5/3
There is a slant asymptote @ y = 2
There are three slant asymptotes @ y = -2,2, -5/3

questions.question: Does the graph of the given function have any slant asymptotes? If so where?

There are three slant asymptotes @ y =-5/2, -3, 3
